The property as per the schedule below was acquired by my ancestors and after the wars it came to me and I am in possession of the said property in full rightful possession. In the place where it is located, I have built a house with an R.C.C. terrace house and an A.C.C. sheet shed on my own, and I am paying all the Panchayat taxes in my name, and I am enjoying the property with all rights and indisputably. Accordingly, I, being my wife, out of the great love I have for you, do hereby give you, free of charge, the immovable property of Rs. 9,10,000/- as per the schedule below, to which I alone have full and absolute rights, and I hereby completely relinquish all my full and absolute rights over the said property and transfer all such rights to you and I hereby transfer the said property to you on this very day. Therefore, from now on, if you keep the property in your possession and pay all the taxes due to the government, the Panchayat, etc. on that property, without any dispute with me, and if you, your children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren, enjoy the property with full rights of exchange, sale, donation, and inheritance, then neither you nor your heirs, nor I nor my heirs, will be able to make any kind of claims, disputes, etc. against you. I will be the one who will bear all such claims, disputes, etc., regardless of who caused them in the past. I am able to settle the Scheduled Property at my own expense and at my own risk and freely dispose of it under you. The Scheduled Property is not the assigned property of the Government. This property does not belong to the Government or any Government Institution. It is not mortgaged to any such Institution. chod{Sheet Endorsement

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 492 of 2026, dated 28/Jan/2026, executed by Chinta Anil, in favour of His Wife, Chinta Aruna Kumari, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 68 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 13-87, Assessment number 2487, comprised in survey number 48, situated in Kolakaluru Village and Grama Panchayath, within the District of Guntur, registered at sub-registrar office Tenali (713), is bounded as follows: North by: Property of Chinta Suresh South by: Property of Dara Kumar East by: Joint Galli West by: Property of Tullimilli Samuyelu.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
